decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

The applicant is advised that if the development hereby approved is carried out concurrently with or prior to the permitted development works subject of Certificate of Lawfulness issued under reference D0147.22, then the works subject of D0147.22 may no longer be lawful and the Certificate may no longer be able to be relied upon.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent via telephone and email. The revisions involved the exclusion of the rear box dormer from the proposal. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 5th of June 2022.
description: Alteration to the roof with 3x front dormers including removal of the existing rear conservatory.
